bigD 0.1.0.9000

bigD

The goal of bigD is to flexibly format dates and times to a given locale.

Given the ISO-8601 date string "2018-07-04" we can use formatting strings to precisely get the date in the form we need.

fmt_dt(input = "2018-07-04", dt_format = "y/M/d")
2018/7/4
fmt_dt(input = "2018-07-04", dt_format = "MMMM d, y.")
July 4, 2018.

With the locale option, we can localize the date.

fmt_dt(input = "2018-07-04", dt_format = "d. MMMM y (EEEE).", locale = "de")
4. Juli 2018 (Mittwoch).

With a datetime string, we have more possibilities.

fmt_dt(
  input = "2018-07-24T14:44:22.234343-0800",
  dt_format = "MMM dd HH:mm:ss ZZZZ yyyy",
  locale = "fr"
)
juil. 24 14:44:22 GMT-8:00 2018
fmt_dt(
  input = "2018-07-24T14:44:22.234343-0800",
  dt_format = "MMMM dd HH:mm:ss 'yy XX",
  locale = "fi"
)
hein√§kuuta 24 14:44:22 '18 -0800

Installation

Want to try this out? The bigD package can be installed from CRAN:

install.packages("bigD")

Also, you can install the development version of bigD from GitHub:

devtools::install_github("rich-iannone/bigD")

If you encounter a bug, have usage questions, or want to share ideas to make this package better, feel free to file an issue.

Code of Conduct

Please note that the rich-iannone/bigD project is released with a contributor code of conduct.
By participating in this project you agree to abide by its terms.
